messages.subject: Have any of you read?
messages.msgSnippet: The Happy Child by Harrison? I just finished it and found it very thought provoking. The writer mentions Holt and Neill as some of his inspiration so I was
messages.messageBody:
The Happy Child by Harrison? I just finished it and found it very
thought provoking. The writer mentions Holt and Neill as some of his
inspiration so I was hopeing it is okey that I ask. I had a rather
hard day myself, icy here and we lost electricity 3 times, but the
worse is that I think my ds is coming down sick because he treated
me terribly all day today, perhaps I have the winter blues as well..
I'm on a new book now "Making it up as we go along - the Albany Free
school story" seems interesting but even in NY it appears that they
were getting state $ for meals and several volunteer teachers and
other resources that I'm sure that here in Missouri we are not going
to get. It's important to me that everyone be able to have a good
quality education not just those who can afford to homeschool or
afford private school tuition, I saw a "free school" starting in AZ
that looked nice and was planning on going on "donations" alone, I
don't know how they expect to keep that up as well, the property
taxes alone are terrible! Let alone things like food and books!!!
